<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC. and SUBSIDIARIES</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Tax benefits of approximately $653&nbsp;million in November
2006, $272&nbsp;million in November 2005 and $330&nbsp;million
in November 2004, related to the delivery of common stock
underlying restricted stock units and the exercise of options,
were credited directly to &#147;Additional paid-in capital&#148;
in the consolidated statements of financial condition and
changes in shareholders&#146; equity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='325'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Note 15. Regulation" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Note&nbsp;15.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Regulation</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The firm is regulated by the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange
Commission (SEC)&nbsp;as a Consolidated Supervised Entity (CSE).
As such, it is subject to group-wide supervision and examination
by the SEC and to minimum capital requirements on a consolidated
basis. As of November 2006 and November 2005, the firm was in
compliance with the CSE capital requirements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The firm&#146;s principal U.S.&nbsp;regulated subsidiaries
include Goldman, Sachs&nbsp;&#38; Co. (GS&#38;Co.) and Goldman
Sachs Execution&nbsp;&#38; Clearing, L.P. (GSEC). GS&#38;Co. and
GSEC are registered U.S.&nbsp;broker-dealers and futures
commission merchants subject to
Rule&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">15c3-1</FONT> of the
SEC and Rule&nbsp;1.17 of the Commodity Futures Trading
Commission, which specify uniform minimum net capital
requirements, as defined, for their registrants, and also
require that a significant part of the registrants&#146; assets
be kept in relatively liquid form. GS&#38;Co. and GSEC have
elected to compute their minimum capital requirements in
accordance with the &#147;Alternative Net Capital
Requirement&#148; as permitted by
Rule&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">15c3-1.</FONT> As of
November 2006 and November 2005, GS&#38;Co. and GSEC had net
capital in excess of their minimum capital requirements. In
addition to its alternative minimum net capital requirements,
GS&#38;Co. is also required to hold tentative net capital in
excess of $1&nbsp;billion and net capital in excess of
$500&nbsp;million in accordance with the market and credit risk
standards of Appendix&nbsp;E of
Rule&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">15c3-1.</FONT>
GS&#38;Co. is also required to notify the SEC in the event that
its tentative net capital is less than $5&nbsp;billion. As of
November 2006 and November 2005, GS&#38;Co. had tentative net
capital and net capital in excess of both the minimum and the
notification requirements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Goldman Sachs Bank USA (GS Bank), a wholly owned industrial
bank, is regulated by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation
and the State of Utah Department of Financial Institutions and
is subject to minimum capital requirements. As of November 2006,
GS Bank was in compliance with all regulatory capital
requirements. GS Bank had approximately $10.59&nbsp;billion of
interest-bearing deposits as of November 2006, which are
included in &#147;Payables to customers and counterparties&#148;
in the consolidated statements of financial condition.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The firm has U.S.&nbsp;insurance subsidiaries that are subject
to state insurance regulation in the states in which they are
domiciled and in the other states in which they are licensed. In
addition, certain of the firm&#146;s insurance subsidiaries are
regulated by the Bermuda Registrar of Companies. The firm&#146;s
insurance subsidiaries were in compliance with all regulatory
capital requirements as of November 2006 and November 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The firm&#146;s principal
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&nbsp;</FONT>regulated
subsidiaries include Goldman Sachs International (GSI)&nbsp;and
Goldman Sachs Japan Co., Ltd. (GSJCL). GSI, the firm&#146;s
regulated U.K. broker-dealer, is subject to the capital
requirements of the U.K.&#146;s Financial Services Authority.
GSJCL, the firm&#146;s regulated Japanese broker-dealer, is
subject to the capital requirements of Japan&#146;s Financial
Services Agency. Prior to October&nbsp;1, 2006, Goldman Sachs
(Japan) Ltd. (GSJL), the predecessor to GSJCL, was the primary
regulated subsidiary based in Japan. As of November 2006 and
November&nbsp;2005, GSI, GSJCL and GSJL were in compliance with
their local capital adequacy requirements. Certain other
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&nbsp;</FONT>subsidiaries
of the firm are also subject to capital adequacy requirements
promulgated by authorities of the countries in which they
operate. As of November&nbsp;2006 and November 2005, these
subsidiaries were in compliance with their local capital
adequacy requirements.
</DIV>

</FONT>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">160
</FONT>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC. and SUBSIDIARIES</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The regulatory requirements referred to above restrict Group
Inc.&#146;s ability to withdraw capital from its regulated
subsidiaries. As of November 2006, approximately
$14.15&nbsp;billion of net assets of regulated subsidiaries were
restricted as to the payment of dividends to Group Inc.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='326'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Note 16. Business Segments" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Note&nbsp;16.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Business Segments</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
In reporting to management, the firm&#146;s operating results
are categorized into the following three segments: Investment
Banking, Trading and Principal Investments, and Asset Management
and Securities Services.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Basis of Presentation</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
In reporting segments, certain of the firm&#146;s business lines
have been aggregated where they have similar economic
characteristics and are similar in each of the following areas:
(i)&nbsp;the nature of the services they provide,
(ii)&nbsp;their methods of distribution, (iii)&nbsp;the types of
clients they serve and (iv)&nbsp;the regulatory environments in
which they operate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The cost drivers of the firm taken as a whole&nbsp;&#151;
compensation, headcount and levels of business
activity&nbsp;&#151; are broadly similar in each of the
firm&#146;s business segments. Compensation and benefits
expenses within the firm&#146;s segments reflect, among other
factors, the overall performance of the firm as well as the
performance of individual business units. Consequently, pre-tax
margins in one segment of the firm&#146;s business may be
significantly affected by the performance of the firm&#146;s
other business segments.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The firm allocates revenues and expenses among the three
segments. Due to the integrated nature of the business segments,
estimates and judgments have been made in allocating certain
revenue and expense items. Transactions between segments are
based on specific criteria or approximate third-party rates.
Total operating expenses include corporate items that have not
been allocated to individual business segments. The allocation
process is based on the manner in which management views the
business of the firm.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The segment information presented in the table below is prepared
according to the following methodologies:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#149;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Revenues and expenses directly associated with each segment are
    included in determining pre-tax earnings.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#149;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Net revenues in the firm&#146;s segments include allocations of
    interest income and interest expense to specific securities,
    commodities and other positions in relation to the cash
    generated by, or funding requirements of, such underlying
    positions. Net interest is included within segment net revenues
    as it is consistent with the way in which management assesses
    segment performance.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#149;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Overhead expenses not directly allocable to specific segments
    are allocated ratably based on direct segment expenses.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

</FONT>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">161
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Geographic Information</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Due to the highly integrated nature of international financial
markets, the firm manages its businesses based on the
profitability of the enterprise as a whole. Accordingly,
management believes that profitability by geographic region is
not necessarily meaningful. In addition, as a significant
portion of the firm&#146;s activities require cross-border
coordination in order to facilitate the needs of the firm&#146;s
clients, the methodology for allocating the firm&#146;s
profitability to geographic regions is dependent on the judgment
of management. During 2006, the firm amended its methodology for
allocating profitability by geographic region. Prior periods
have been reclassified to conform to the current presentation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Geographic results are generally allocated as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#149;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Investment Banking: location of the client and investment
    banking team.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#149;&nbsp;</TD>

    Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities, and Equities: location
    of the trading desk.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

<TR>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='328'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "SUPPLEMENTAL FINANCIAL INFORMATION" -->

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>SUPPLEMENTAL FINANCIAL INFORMATION</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 3pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<A name='329'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Quarterly Results (unaudited)" -->

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>Quarterly Results (unaudited)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The following represents the firm&#146;s unaudited quarterly
results for 2006 and 2005. These quarterly results were prepared
in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and
reflect all adjustments that are, in the opinion of management,
necessary for a fair statement of the results. These adjustments
are of a normal recurring nature.
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

<CENTER>
<TABLE width="92%" align="center" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt; margin-top: 6pt; ">

<TR style="font-size: 1pt;">
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="57%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="font-size: 8.0pt;">
    <TD colspan="2">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="15" align="center" nowrap><B><FONT face="helvetica,arial">2006 Quarter</FONT></B></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="2">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="15" align="center" nowrap style="border-top: 1pt solid #000000;">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 8.0pt;">
    <TD colspan="2">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="center" nowrap><B><FONT face="helvetica,arial">First</FONT></B></TD>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Beginning in the fourth quarter of 2006, &#147;Cost of power
    generation&#148; in the consolidated statements of earnings was
    reclassified to operating expenses. &#147;Cost of power
    generation&#148; was previously reported as a reduction to
    revenues. Prior periods have been reclassified to conform to the
    current presentation, with no impact to the firm&#146;s reported
    net earnings.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The timing and magnitude of changes in the firm&#146;s bonus
    accruals can have a significant effect on results in a given
    quarter.</TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

of the firm&#146;s common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
On January 26, 2007, the last reported sales price for the
firm&#146;s common stock on the New York Stock Exchange was
$213.50 per share.

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Beginning in the fourth quarter of 2006, &#147;Cost of power
    generation&#148; in the consolidated statements of earnings was
    reclassified to operating expenses. &#147;Cost of power
    generation&#148; was previously reported as a reduction to
    revenues. Prior periods have been reclassified to conform to the
    current presentation, with no impact to the firm&#146;s reported
    pre-tax earnings.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Book value per common share is based on common shares
    outstanding, including restricted stock units granted to
    employees with no future service requirements, of
    450.1&nbsp;million, 460.4&nbsp;million, 494.0&nbsp;million,
    496.1&nbsp;million and 491.2&nbsp;million as of November 2006,
    November 2005, November 2004, November 2003 and November 2002,
    respectively.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(3)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Beginning in 2006, includes employees of the firm&#146;s
    consolidated property management and loan servicing
    subsidiaries. Prior periods have been adjusted to conform to the
    current presentation.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Substantially all assets under management are valued as of
    calendar month-end.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(5)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In the first quarter of 2006, the firm changed the methodology
    for classifying certain non-money market assets. The changes
    were made primarily to reclassify certain assets allocated to
    external investment managers out of alternative investment
    assets and to reclassify currency funds into alternative
    investment assets. The changes did not impact total assets under
    management and prior periods have been reclassified to conform
    to the current presentation.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(6)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Primarily includes hedge funds, private equity, real estate,
    currencies, commodities and asset allocation strategies.</TD>
</TR>

<!-- link1 "Item 9. Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;9.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting
    and Financial Disclosure</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
There were no changes in or disagreements with accountants on
accounting and financial disclosure during the last two fiscal
years.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='126'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 9A. Controls and Procedures" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;9A.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Controls and Procedures</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
As of the end of the period covered by this report, an
evaluation was carried out by Goldman Sachs&#146; management,
with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of our disclosure
controls and procedures (as defined in
Rule&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">13a-15(e)</FONT>
under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934). Based upon that
evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer concluded that these disclosure controls and procedures
were effective as of the end of the period covered by this
report. In addition, no change in our internal control over
financial reporting (as defined in
Rule&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">13a-15(f)</FONT>
under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934) occurred during the
fourth quarter of our fiscal year ended November&nbsp;24, 2006
that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial
Reporting and the Report of Independent Registered Public
Accounting Firm thereon are set forth in Part&nbsp;II,
Item&nbsp;8 of the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='127'></A>
</DIV>

Not applicable.

<!-- link1 "PART III" -->

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>PART&nbsp;III</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='129'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 10. Directors and Executive Officers of the Registrant" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;10.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Directors and Executive Officers of the Registrant</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Information relating to the Registrant&#146;s executive officers
is included on pages&nbsp;43 to 44 of the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.</FONT>
Information relating to directors of the Registrant, including
its audit committee and audit committee financial experts, and
its executive officers will be in the Registrant&#146;s
definitive Proxy Statement for its 2007 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders to be held on March&nbsp;27, 2007, which will be
filed within 120&nbsp;days of the end of our fiscal year ended
November&nbsp;24, 2006 (the 2007 Proxy Statement) and is
incorporated herein by reference. Information relating to the
Registrant&#146;s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics that
applies to its senior financial officers, as defined in the
Code, is included in Part&nbsp;I, Item&nbsp;1 of the Annual
Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='130'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 11. Executive Compensation" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;11.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Executive Compensation</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Information relating to the Registrant&#146;s executive officer
and director compensation will be in the 2007 Proxy Statement
and is incorporated herein by reference.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

    <TD width="94%"></TD>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Represents shares remaining to be issued under the SIP
    (239,746,882&nbsp;shares) and the 1999 Plan
    (454,714&nbsp;shares). The total number of shares of common
    stock that may be delivered pursuant to awards granted under the
    SIP initially may not exceed 250,000,000&nbsp;shares. Beginning
    November&nbsp;29, 2008 and each fiscal year thereafter, the
    number of shares of common stock that may be delivered pursuant
    to awards granted after April&nbsp;1, 2003 under the SIP may not
    exceed 5% of our issued and outstanding shares of common stock,
    determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding
    fiscal year, increased by the number of shares that were
    available for awards in previous fiscal years but were not, at
    the date of determination, covered by awards granted in previous
    years.</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 8.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 8.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
Cash payments for third-party interest, net of capitalized
interest, were $6.11&nbsp;billion, $3.69&nbsp;billion and
$1.70&nbsp;billion for the years ended November 2006, November
2005 and November 2004, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 8.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 3pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
Cash payments for income taxes, net of refunds, were
$2.86&nbsp;billion, $1.52&nbsp;billion and $284&nbsp;million for
the years ended November 2006, November 2005 and November 2004,
respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 9.8pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 9pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
The accompanying notes are an integral part of these condensed
nonconsolidated financial statements.
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>SCHEDULE I</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>(PARENT COMPANY ONLY)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<A name='338'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS" -->

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Note&nbsp;1.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Significant Accounting Policies</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Basis of Presentation</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The condensed nonconsolidated financial statements of The
Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (the parent company), a Delaware
corporation, should be read in conjunction with the consolidated
financial statements of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. and
subsidiaries (the firm) and notes thereto (the consolidated
financial statements), which are included in Part&nbsp;II,
Item&nbsp;8 of the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.</FONT> These
condensed nonconsolidated financial statements reflect the
results of operations, financial condition and cash flows for
the parent company only. Investments in subsidiaries are
accounted for using the equity method of accounting prescribed
by Accounting Principles Board (APB)&nbsp;Opinion No.&nbsp;18,
&#147;The Equity Method of Accounting for Investments in Common
Stock.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Unless otherwise stated herein, all references to
November&nbsp;2006, November&nbsp;2005 and November&nbsp;2004
refer to the parent company&#146;s fiscal years ended, or the
dates, as the context requires, November&nbsp;24,&nbsp;2006,
November&nbsp;25,&nbsp;2005 and November&nbsp;26,&nbsp;2004,
respectively. Certain reclassifications have been made to
previously reported amounts to conform to the current
presentation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company&#146;s significant accounting policies are
identical to those used by the firm, to the extent applicable to
the parent company&#146;s activities. For further information
regarding the firm&#146;s significant accounting policies, refer
to Note&nbsp;2 to the consolidated financial statements in
Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Use of Estimates</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
These condensed nonconsolidated financial statements have been
prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles that require management to make certain estimates and
assumptions. The most important of these estimates and
assumptions relate to fair value measurements, the accounting
for goodwill and identifiable intangible assets and the
provision for potential losses that may arise from litigation
and regulatory proceedings and tax audits. Although these and
other estimates and assumptions are based on the best available
information, actual results could be materially different from
these estimates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Equity Method Investments</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Substantially all of the firm&#146;s unsecured funding is raised
by the parent company. The parent company then lends the
necessary funds to its subsidiaries, some of which are
regulated, to meet their asset financing and capital
requirements. In addition, the parent company provides its
regulated subsidiaries with the necessary capital to meet their
regulatory requirements. Such funding is included in &#147;Loans
to subsidiaries&#148; and &#147;Subordinated loans to
subsidiaries&#148; in the condensed nonconsolidated statements
of financial condition. Intercompany exposure is managed by
requiring senior and subordinated intercompany loans to have
maturities equal to or shorter than the maturities of the
aggregate borrowings of the parent company. This policy ensures
that the subsidiaries&#146; obligations to the parent company
will generally mature in advance of the parent company&#146;s
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT> borrowings.
In addition, many of the subsidiaries pledge collateral at loan
value to cover their intercompany borrowings (other than
subordinated debt) in order to mitigate parent company liquidity
risk. Equity investments in subsidiaries are generally funded
with equity
</DIV>

</FONT>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">F-5
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>(PARENT COMPANY ONLY)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
capital and included in &#147;Investments in subsidiaries&#148;
in the condensed nonconsolidated statements of financial
condition.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company enters into derivative contracts with
subsidiaries to hedge its net investment in
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&nbsp;</FONT>operations
and to manage the interest rate and currency exposure on its
unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
borrowings and certain unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT> borrowings.
To manage exposure on its borrowings, the parent company uses
derivatives to effectively convert a substantial portion of its
unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
borrowings into
U.S.&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">dollar-based</FONT>
floating rate obligations. The parent company applies fair value
hedge accounting to derivative contracts that hedge the
benchmark interest rate (i.e., London Interbank Offered Rate
(LIBOR)) on its fixed rate unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings.
Derivative balances with subsidiaries, included in
&#147;Financial instruments owned, at fair value&#148; and
&#147;Financial instruments sold, but not yet purchased, at fair
value&#148; in the condensed nonconsolidated statements of
financial condition, were $6.16&nbsp;billion and
$347&nbsp;million, and $2.79&nbsp;billion and $464&nbsp;million,
as of November&nbsp;2006 and November&nbsp;2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Interest income is largely generated from loans made to
subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company also allocates substantially all rental and
other costs relating to properties occupied by certain
subsidiaries. The parent company additionally allocates the cost
of <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">share-based</FONT>
compensation programs to subsidiaries relating to costs
associated with employees of those subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Note&nbsp;2.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Short-Term</FONT>
    Borrowings</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company obtains
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT> unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT> borrowings
primarily through the issuance of promissory notes, commercial
paper and hybrid debt instruments. As of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005, these borrowings were $32.63&nbsp;billion
and $39.98&nbsp;billion, respectively. Such amounts include the
portion of <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT>
unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
borrowings maturing within one year of the financial statement
date and <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT>
unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
borrowings that are redeemable within one year of the financial
statement date at the option of the holder. The carrying value
of these <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT>
obligations approximates fair value due to their
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT> nature.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT>
borrowings with third parties are set forth below:
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Hybrid debt instruments are financial instruments that contain
    bifurcatable embedded derivatives, $1.17&nbsp;billion of which
    were accounted for at fair value under Statement of Financial
    Accounting Standards (SFAS)&nbsp;No.&nbsp;155, &#147;Accounting
    for Certain Hybrid Financial Instruments&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;an
    amendment of FASB Statements No.&nbsp;133 and 140,&#148; as of
    November&nbsp;2006.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The weighted average interest rates for these borrowings were
    5.33% and 4.17% as of November 2006 and November 2005,
    respectively. The weighted average interest rates, after giving
    effect to hedging activities, were 5.36% and 4.16% as of
    November&nbsp;2006 and November&nbsp;2005, respectively. The
    weighted average interest rates as of November 2006 excluded
    hybrid debt instruments accounted for at fair value under
    SFAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;155.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>(PARENT COMPANY ONLY)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
In addition, the parent company may borrow overnight funds from
certain subsidiaries on an unsecured basis. As of
November&nbsp;2006 and November&nbsp;2005, such amounts were
$1.54&nbsp;billion and $1.44&nbsp;billion, respectively, and
included in &#147;Unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT>
borrowings&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;With subsidiaries&#148; in the
condensed nonconsolidated statements of financial condition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TR valign="top">

    Borrowings</B></TD>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company obtains
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT> unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings
that consist principally of senior borrowings with maturities
extending to 2036. As of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005, these borrowings were $119.04&nbsp;billion
and $79.76&nbsp;billion, respectively.
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 3.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <DIV style="width: 25%; border-top: 1.0pt solid black; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
    borrowings maturing within one year of the financial statement
    date and certain unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings
    that are redeemable within one year of the financial statement
    date at the option of the holder are included as unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT> borrowings
    in the condensed nonconsolidated statements of financial
    condition.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3.0pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
    borrowings that are repayable prior to maturity at the option of
    the parent company are reflected at their contractual maturity
    dates. Unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings
    that are redeemable prior to maturity at the option of the
    holder are reflected at the dates such options become
    exercisable.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company enters into derivative contracts with
subsidiaries, such as interest rate futures contracts, interest
rate swap agreements, currency swap agreements, and
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">equity-linked</FONT> and
indexed contracts, to effectively convert a substantial portion
of its <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">third-party</FONT>
unsecured <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
borrowings into
U.S.&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">dollar-based</FONT>
floating rate obligations. Accordingly, the carrying value of
these unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings
approximated fair value as of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The effective weighted average interest rates for unsecured
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT> borrowings
with third parties are set forth below:
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

<CENTER>

    condition.</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

    <TD width="99%"></TD>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Subordinated Borrowings</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Unsecured long-term borrowings with third parties include
$7.34&nbsp;billion and $2.88&nbsp;billion of subordinated
borrowings as of November 2006 and November 2005, respectively,
as set forth below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Subordinated Notes.</B> As of November 2006, the parent
company had $4.50&nbsp;billion of subordinated notes outstanding
with maturities ranging from 2008 to 2036. The effective
weighted average interest rate on these subordinated notes was
5.45%, after giving effect to derivative contracts used to
convert fixed rate obligations into floating rate obligations.
As of November 2005, the parent company had $40&nbsp;million of
subordinated notes outstanding maturing in 2008 with an interest
rate of 12.00%. These notes are junior in right of payment to
all of the parent company&#146;s senior indebtedness.
</DIV>

</FONT>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">F-9

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>(PARENT COMPANY ONLY)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Refer to Note&nbsp;5 to the consolidated financial statements in
Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K</FONT> for
information on junior subordinated debentures issued by the
parent company to Goldman Sachs Capital Trust&nbsp;I (the Trust).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Note&nbsp;4.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Commitments, Contingencies and Guarantees</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Commitments</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Letters of Credit.</B> The parent company provides letters of
credit issued by various banks to counterparties in lieu of
securities or cash to satisfy various collateral requirements.
Letters of credit outstanding were $171&nbsp;million and
$25&nbsp;million as of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Merchant Banking Commitments.</B> The parent company acts as
an investor in merchant banking transactions, which includes
making <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
investments in equity and debt instruments in privately
negotiated transactions, corporate acquisitions and real estate
transactions. In connection with these activities, the parent
company had commitments to invest up to $6.34&nbsp;billion and
$3.49&nbsp;billion in corporate and real estate investment funds
as of November&nbsp;2006 and November&nbsp;2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap"><B>Construction-Related</FONT>
Commitments.</B> As of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005, the parent company had
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">construction-related</FONT>
commitments of $2&nbsp;million and $19&nbsp;million,
respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Other.</B> The parent company had other commitments of
$2&nbsp;million and $305&nbsp;million as of November&nbsp;2006
and November&nbsp;2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Leases.</B> The parent company has contractual obligations
under <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
noncancelable lease agreements, principally for office space,
expiring on various dates through 2029. Certain agreements are
subject to periodic escalation provisions for increases in real
estate taxes and other charges. Future minimum rental payments,
net of minimum sublease rentals, which are generally reimbursed
by subsidiaries, are set forth below:
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

<CENTER>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">F-10
</FONT>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>THE GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, INC.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>(PARENT COMPANY ONLY)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 24pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="99%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Guarantees</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The parent company has guaranteed the payment obligations of
Goldman, Sachs&nbsp;&#38; Co., its principal
U.S.&nbsp;broker-dealer subsidiary (other than nonrecourse
payment obligations). In addition, the parent company guarantees
many of the obligations of its other consolidated subsidiaries
on a
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">transaction-by-transaction</FONT>
basis, as negotiated with the counterparty. The parent company
is unable to develop an estimate of the maximum payout under its
subsidiary guarantees; however, because these guaranteed
obligations are also obligations of consolidated subsidiaries
and included in the consolidated statements of financial
condition or disclosed in Note&nbsp;6 to the consolidated
financial statements in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 of the Annual
Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K,</FONT> the
parent company&#146;s liabilities as guarantor are not
separately disclosed herein.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The following tables set forth certain information about the
parent company&#146;s guarantees as of November&nbsp;2006 and
November&nbsp;2005:
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

<CENTER>
<TABLE width="92%" align="center" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-size: 10.0pt; margin-top: 6pt; ">

<FONT face="helvetica,arial">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>POWER OF ATTORNEY</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose
signature appears below constitutes and appoints Lloyd C.
Blankfein, Gary D. Cohn, Jon Winkelried, David A. Viniar,
Gregory K. Palm and Esta E. Stecher, and each of them severally,
his or her true and lawful
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">attorney-in</FONT>-fact with
power of substitution and resubstitution to sign in his or her
name, place and stead, in any and all capacities, to do any and
all things and execute any and all instruments that such
attorney may deem necessary or advisable under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 and any rules, regulations and requirements
of the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission in
connection with the Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K</FONT> and any
and all amendments hereto, as fully for all intents and purposes
as he or she might or could do in person, and hereby ratifies
and confirms all said
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">attorneys-in</FONT>-fact and
agents, each acting alone, and his or her substitute or
substitutes, may lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue
hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10.0pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of
1934, this report has been signed below by the following persons
on behalf of the Registrant and in the capacities and on the
dates indicated.
</DIV>
<FONT face="times new roman,times">

    <TD colspan="3" align="center" valign="top">
    <FONT face="helvetica,arial">/s/
    <FONT style="font-variant:SMALL-CAPS">Lloyd C. Blankfein<BR>
    <DIV style="font-size: 1pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV></FONT></FONT><FONT face="helvetica,arial">Lloyd
    C. Blankfein
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
    <FONT face="helvetica,arial">Director, Chairman and Chief
    Executive Officer (Principal Executive Officer)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">
    <FONT face="helvetica,arial">February&nbsp;5, 2007
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

    <TD colspan="7">&nbsp;</TD>
